page.title: 07INDUSTRY IN SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: There is comparatively little industry in the Shillingstone area. In 1924 the Shillingstone lime works was started to extract lime from the Middle Chalk beds in the area by quarrying,and a large area of Shillingstone Hill has now been excavated.The works now cover an area of 34 acres.Annual production around 20,000 tons.It is supplied to builders merchants throughout the South West,and to farmers as agricultual lime.Pre-war 30 workers employed,now 4.There are 3 kilns for burning the limeto make quicklime. In the old railway yard are 3 related firms,Intasco (veneered table tops with brass inlays) Resistec (Brass labels) and Hambledon Furniture (Solid wood furniture).Set up 3 years ago they employ around 60 workers.
